title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: FA Fund Management allows you to set up and use workflows that handle NAV calculation:

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Regular NAV calculation workflow to calculate NAV and fees regularly, for example, every day.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow to calculate NAV for reporting purposes between the scheduled NAV calculations.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: For example, if you have a fund that calculates NAV once a month, you can still calculate unofficial NAV every day to stay on top of the progress. You would have separate schedules set for each workflow.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: A separate workflow lets you handle deferrals:

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow for funds with income distribution. This workflow allows you to run deferral calculation in FA Fund management app and saves the bookkeeping postings before you calculate NAV.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Regular NAV calculation workflow is used for calculating NAV and fees for your fund regularly, for example, every day or every week. If NAV has to be calculated today, the fund has the Pending NAV status. During the calculation, FA Fund Management check your data and shows you warnings if there is something to pay attention to. You can view all NAV details in the NAV window (double-click your fund). When you accept NAV, FA Fund Management:

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Updates the share class prices (see Market data info in FA Back reference for details).

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Updates the share class outstanding units (see Basic info in FA Back reference for details).

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Updates unit price for the incoming orders.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Generates NAV report and saves it in your fund portfolio’s documents.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Generates accrued fee transactions to the fund.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: If configured so, executes incoming trade orders using the calculated unit price and generates transactions to the fund portfolio. Transactions are grouped per share class, settlement date, and type (subscription or redemption). For example, one transaction is generated for all share class A subscriptions with the same settlement date. For more details about generated transactions, see Questions about workflows and NAV statuses. If redemption is part of a switch order that is registered in FA Back (meaning that a customer exchanges fund units for a different fund), FA Fund Management updates the amount of the linked subscription order with the amount received from the redemption.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: If configured so, updates fund security allocations in FA Back. FA analyses fund portfolio investments on the NAV date and updates the allocation structure on the fund security in FA Back for the NAV date.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: If your FA Fund management app is configured to run deferrals, and if you entered the accounting rules in fund settings (see Create a fund), the system marks the postings that were used to calculate accrued income as "Reported".

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: The statuses of NAV calculation for the regular workflow are:

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: No action

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: No action needs to be taken today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: No schedule

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Calculation schedules for the fund aren’t set.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Pending NAV

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV needs to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate NAV for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept these first to be able to calculate the current day’s NAV.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Calculated

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV was already calculated.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Warning

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV was calculated with warnings that might need your attention (see View warnings).

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Rejected

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV calculation results were rejected by the user. NAV needs to be calculated again today.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Accepted

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV calculation result was accepted.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Error

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV calculation or acceptance failed because of the system error on the FA side (this is a rare situation). You can revert the changes and re-run the process using the Roll back failed calculation and Roll back failed acceptance buttons. For details, see Calculate NAV and Accept NAV.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: You can schedule unofficial calculation of NAV and fees for your fund between the official dates. This workflow is for your information only. It allows you to follow NAV for your fund. Unofficial calculation doesn’t price share classes nor incoming orders. The calculation workflow is similar to the regular one, without the last acceptance step.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: The statuses for unofficial NAV calculation workflow are:

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: No action

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: No action needs to be taken today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Pending unofficial NAV

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Unofficial NAV needs to be calculated. If you didn’t calculate unofficial NAV for the previous days, you need to calculate these first to be able to calculate the current unofficial NAV.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Calculated unofficial NAV

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Unofficial NAV is already calculated. This status is shown only in the NAV window.

title: Non-scheduled calculations
body: You can calculate and accept NAV or unofficial NAV outside the schedule, if this is required by your business process. To turn on this feature, allow non-scheduled calculations in the Fund wizard, Schedules tab (see Create a fund).

title: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow
body: If you have deferral runs set up for your fund, FA Fund Management prompts you to run deferrals each time before you calculate NAV. A deferral run generates and saves bookkeeping postings for income distribution. Then, when you calculate NAV, FA calculates accrued income based on the generated postings. After running deferrals, the workflow is similar to the NAV calculation workflow.

title: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow
body: In addition to the NAV calculation workflow statuses, this workflow has a Pending deferrals status which means that you need to run deferrals before calculating NAV.

title: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow
body: Deferrals for a fund are set in the Fund wizard, Accounting tab (see Create a fund). To learn more about deferrals, the Run deferrals section in FA User guide.

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: What happens if I forget to calculate or accept NAV?

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: FA Fund Management doesn’t let you skip scheduled calculations. So if you didn’t calculate or accept the pending NAV on the previous day, you have to do this on the current day before you calculate today’s NAV.

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: How can I set the transaction date and settlement date of client subscriptions and redemptions when I accept NAV?

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: The transaction date is automatically set to the NAV date (the date when NAV is accepted), so you can't change it.

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: The settlement date of a transaction is copied from the trade order. If no settlement date is specified in the trade order, FA defines it based on the Fund settings in FA Back. The fund settings let you set the default settlement date as "transaction date + N days" (by default, N=0 and transaction date is used as a settlement date).

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: My fund has unpaid subscriptions that are executed during NAV acceptance but I am unsure when the client will pay. How do I handle them?

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: To handle this case correctly, modify the trade order settlement date in FA Back. FA will generate separate transactions per trade order. You can specify the transaction type to use for such transactions (for example, “unpaid”) and manage these transactions separately.

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: My fund has an incoming trade order from an account in a different currency. How do I handle the exchange?

title: Questions about workflows and NAV statuses
body: When you accept NAV, FA Fund management checks if the FX rate is set for the trade order. If the FX rate is missing, it adds the latest available FX rate in the trade order or transaction (if FA is configured to execute trade orders automatically when NAV is accepted).

title: Use four-eyes approval of NAV
body: You can set up four-eyes approval to ensure that NAV is calculated and accepted by two separate users. When four-eyes approval of NAV is enabled, you can't accept NAV yourself after calculating it.

title: Use four-eyes approval of NAV
body: To enable four-eyes approval of NAV, do the following:

title: Use four-eyes approval of NAV
body: Open NAV status view, click the icon, and select Settings.

title: Use four-eyes approval of NAV
body: Tick the checkbox Use four-eyes approval of NAV.

title: Use four-eyes approval of NAV
body: Click Save.

title: Use four-eyes approval of NAV
body: Four-eyes approval is now enabled for all funds. You can disable four-eyes approval by unticking the same setting. All users can add comments regarding the calculation and acceptance in NAV overview, Details tab (see View NAV details and comments).

title: Calculate NAV
body: You can calculate NAV for one or more funds in the NAV status view. You can also enable four-eyes approval of NAV to ensure that two separate users calculate and accept the NAV (see Use four-eyes approval of NAV).

title: Calculate NAV
body: To calculate NAV for one fund, do the following:

title: Calculate NAV
body: Click on a fund in the NAV status view. Make sure the fund status is "Pending NAV" or "Pending unofficial NAV".

title: Calculate NAV
body: Click Calculate NAV in the Fund details pane.

title: Calculate NAV
body: Check the calculation details and warnings (see View and check NAV calculation). You can add comments to the NAV calculation in NAV overview, Details tab.

title: Calculate NAV
body: If you need to fix the calculation, you can recalculate NAV or delete the recent calculation (see the sections below). If the calculation is correct, NAV can be accepted (see Accept NAV).

title: Calculate NAV
body: The fund status changes accordingly. You can also calculate NAV for multiple funds simultaneously by selecting the funds in the NAV status view and clicking Calculate NAV.

title: Recalculate NAV
body: If you need to correct the underlying data related, for example, to fee or trade orders after you calculated NAV:

title: Recalculate NAV
body: Make the necessary fixes.

title: Recalculate NAV
body: Select the fund in the NAV status view and click Recalculate NAV.

title: Recalculate NAV
body: You can view the calculation result in the NAV overview. For details, see View and check NAV calculation.

title: Delete NAV calculation
body: You can delete an NAV calculation, for example, if there is an error in the calculation schedule. To delete an NAV calculation, do the following:

title: Delete NAV calculation
body: In the NAV status view, double-click on the fund to open the NAV overview.

title: Delete NAV calculation
body: Click Delete calculation.

title: Delete NAV calculation
body: The NAV calculation data is deleted, and you can calculate NAV again.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: You can interrupt an ongoing NAV calculation.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: We don't recommend stopping an ongoing NAV calculation unless you are confident in what you are doing.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: To stop the NAV calculation, do the following:

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: Click on the fund in the NAV status view to open the Fund details pane.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: Click Stop calculation.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: The NAV calculation is cancelled, and the fund returns to the "Pending NAV" status.

title: Roll back failed calculation
body: You can roll back a failed NAV calculation caused by a system error. Such a situation is indicated by the fund status being "Error". To roll back a failed NAV calculation, do the following:

title: Roll back failed calculation
body: Click on the fund in the NAV status view to open the Fund details pane.

title: Roll back failed calculation
body: Click Roll back failed calculation.

title: Roll back failed calculation
body: The fund returns to the "Pending NAV" status.

title: View and check NAV calculation
body: Double-click the fund in the NAV status view to open NAV overview. This view contains more detailed information about the NAV in different tabs:

title: View and check NAV calculation
body: NAV summary tab shows a summary of NAV for the entire fund.

title: View and check NAV calculation
body: Share classes tab shows NAV per fund share class.

title: View and check NAV calculation
body: Warnings tab shows warnings related to the NAV calculation, fund portfolio and share classes, and limits.

title: View and check NAV calculation
body: Details tab shows the time of latest NAV calculation and acceptance and comments relating to them.

title: View NAV summary and NAV per share class
body: Double-click the fund in the NAV status view to open NAV overview. In the NAV summary tab, you can see an NAV summary for the entire fund. In the Share classes tab, you can see NAV per fund share class. The following sections describe these tabs in more detail.

title: NAV summary

title: NAV summary
body: The Current column shows the items used to calculate the current (accepted or calculated) net asset value for the fund on the chosen date. The Previous columns shows the items used to calculate the fund’s net asset value accepted before the chosen date. The Change column shows the change between the current and previous calculation values.

title: Table rows
body: Gross asset value

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows
body: The total value of unsettled security purchases in the fund portfolio. The details pane shows unsettled transactions that make up the total liabilities amount.

title: Table rows

title: Table rows
body: The total value of non-cash payments accrued by the moment of NAV calculation. The details pane shows receivables summed by transaction type.

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows

title: Table rows
body: Accrued fees in the period from the previous to the current NAV date. The details pane shows fees and amounts summed by transaction type. Hover over the ? icon to view the calculation produced based on the fee formula.

title: Share classes tab
body: The Share classes tab shows the fund NAV per share class. Click a share class to open the details pane that shows NAV calculation details for this share class.

body: New calculated share class NAV which includes swing adjustment. Visible if you calculate swing adjustment separately and don't include it in the official NAV you publish. To learn more about swing pricing in FA Fund management, see Apply swing pricing.

title: Table columns
body: Unswung NAV

title: Table columns
body: New calculated share class NAV without swing adjustment. Visible if you include swing adjustment in the official NAV you publish. To learn more about swing pricing in FA Fund management, see Apply swing pricing.

title: Table columns
body: NAV change %

title: Table columns
body: NAV change since the previous accepted NAV in percentage.

title: Table columns
body: Benchmark change %

title: Table columns
body: Benchmark change since the previous accepted NAV in percentage. To learn more about benchmark setting, see Portfolio window in FA Back reference.

title: Table columns
body: Diff %

title: Table columns
body: Difference between NAV change % and Benchmark change %.

title: Table columns
body: Current units

title: Table columns
body: The number of share class units that is taken into account in the NAV calculation (pending subscriptions aren’t included in this number – the trade orders are executed when you accept NAV).

title: Table columns
body: Change in units

title: Table columns
body: Change in number of outstanding units since the previous NAV calculation.

title: Share class NAV details
body: The NAV details pane on the right shows:

title: Share class NAV details
body: Net asset value

title: Share class NAV details
body: Net asset value of the share class.

title: Share class NAV details
body: Previous NAV units

title: Share class NAV details
body: Number of share class units that was taken into account last time NAV was calculated.

title: Share class NAV details
body: Previous NAV date

title: Share class NAV details
body: The date of previous NAV calculation.

title: Share class NAV details
body: Previous NAV

title: Share class NAV details
body: Previous NAV in the share class.

title: Questions about NAV overview
body: Why do I see “Incomplete data - no preview available” in the NAV overview?

title: Questions about NAV overview
body: This means that you are trying to view the data from previous calculations carried out with the old fund management functionality. NAV overview shows only the data calculated in the FA Fund Management app.

title: View warnings
body: When you calculate NAV, FA Fund Management checks the underlying data and shows you warnings if there is anything to double-check. To view the warnings, double-click the fund in the NAV overview and open the Warnings tab.

title: NAV warnings
body: NAV warnings mean that there is something wrong with the fund or NAV calculation settings, and NAV calculation failed. Possible reasons include:

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account.

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account balance (normal when there are no earlier fees of the type).

title: NAV warnings
body: Cost formula is invalid and doesn't return any transactions.

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Share class and portfolio warnings are based on the decision table rules that check share classes and portfolios. The default decision table contains the following checks that you can adjust:

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Negative positions or cash account balance (portfolio)

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Market price older than calculation date (portfolio)

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 5% for stocks (portfolio)

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 1% for other securities and currencies (portfolio)

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Fund performance vs. benchmark differs by more than 1% (share class)

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: The difference in the outstanding units in the current and previous NAV calculation does not match the number of units from the executed transactions (share class)

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: FX rate has changed more than 5 % (portfolio)

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: To adjust share class and portfolio warnings, see Add warnings for NAV calculation.

title: Limit warnings
body: Limit warnings mean that the fund portfolio positions are close to or outside the warning or breach thresholds set for the portfolio.

title: Limit warnings
body: Warning: portfolio values are beyond the warning threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: Breached: portfolio values are outside the breach threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: To learn more about setting investment limits in FA Back, see UCITS limits.

title: View NAV details and comments
body: In NAV overview, Details tab, you can view and add comments regarding the NAV calculation and acceptance throughout the process. The Details tab also shows you the date and time of the latest NAV calculation and acceptance as well as the users who did them.

title: View NAV details and comments
body: The Comments section shows the comments added for the fund from newest to oldest. For each comment, you can see the name of the user who added it as well as the date and time when the comment was saved. Note that if NAV is rolled back, the comments are deleted. Comments are useful especially if four-eyes approval of NAV is enabled; the user who calculates NAV can leave comments to be read by the user who handles NAV acceptance and vice versa. For more information about four-eyes approval, see Use four-eyes approval of NAV. You can:

title: View NAV details and comments
body: Add a new comment by clicking on the text field.

title: View NAV details and comments
body: Edit comments by clicking the icon. You can't edit other users' comments or comments saved before NAV acceptance after the NAV is accepted.

title: View NAV details and comments
body: Delete comments by clicking the icon. You can't delete other users' comments or comments saved before NAV acceptance after the NAV is accepted.

title: Accept NAV
body: You can accept NAV for one or more funds in the NAV status view. If four-eyes approval of NAV is enabled, the same user who calculated NAV can't accept it (see Use four-eyes approval of NAV).

title: Accept NAV
body: To accept NAV for a single fund, do the following:

title: Accept NAV
body: Click the fund in the NAV status view. Make sure the fund status is "Calculated".

title: Accept NAV
body: Check the NAV calculation details, warnings, and comments (see View and check NAV calculation). You can add comments to the NAV acceptance in NAV overview, Details tab.

title: Accept NAV
body: Accept or reject the NAV calculation:

title: Accept NAV
body: If NAV summary is correct and no warnings need to be addressed, click Accept NAV in the Fund details pane or NAV overview, Details tab. The fund status changes to "Accepted".

title: Accept NAV
body: If fixes are needed and NAV has to be calculated again, click Reject NAV in the Fund details pane or NAV overview, Details tab.

title: Accept NAV
body: You can also accept NAV for multiple funds simultaneously by selecting the funds in the NAV status view and clicking Accept NAV.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Rolling back NAV reverts all actions performed in the acceptance:

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Deletes fee and cash transactions in the fund portfolio in FA Back.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Deletes market data observations for the share class in FA Back.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Changes the status of trade orders executed in the acceptance step to "Executable" and deletes transactions linked to them.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: If performance fee equalization is used for the fund, removes capitalization transactions, removes performance fees, removes compensation trade orders created for subscriptions, and restores compensation trade orders canceled or updated as a result of redemptions.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Updates the calculation schedule and shows the previous accepted NAV as the latest one.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Rolling back unofficial NAV does the following:

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Updates the calculation schedule and shows the previous NAV as the latest one.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: The actions performed during the rollback are logged. To view the log, click in the Fund details pane.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: You can roll back the latest accepted NAV calculation. To cancel several NAV calculations, roll them back one by one, starting with the latest:

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Double-click the fund in the NAV status view to open the NAV overview.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Click Roll back NAV.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Only the latest NAV can be rolled back. The button is only available if you select the latest NAV date at the top of the screen.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Rolling back NAV can take a few moments. After the rollback, you can calculate NAV again.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: You can interrupt an ongoing NAV acceptance. This removes all changes made in FA Back during the acceptance, similar to Roll back accepted NAV, but the latest NAV calculation is preserved.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: To stop ongoing NAV acceptance, do the following:

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: Click the fund in the NAV status view.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: Click View progress in the Fund details pane.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: Click Stop acceptance.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: After interrupting NAV acceptance, you can calculate NAV again.

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: You can roll back a failed NAV acceptance caused by a system error. Such a situation is indicated by the fund status being "Error". To roll back a failed NAV calculation, do the following:

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: In the NAV status view, check the Error column for the fund to see at what stage NAV acceptance was interrupted.

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: Open FA Back and remove any changes made during NAV acceptance (for example, delete the fee or cash transactions).

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: Open FA Fund Management and click on the fund in the NAV status view to open the Fund details pane.

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: Click Roll back failed acceptance.

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: The failed acceptance is cancelled.

title: Pay out fund dividends
body: FA allows you to run dividends for a fund and create dividend transactions via a corporate action. In the Dividends view, can see the dividend history. You can also:

title: Pay out fund dividends
body: Save a view you created by clicking .

title: Pay out fund dividends
body: Restore the view by clicking .

title: Pay out fund dividends
body: Manage saved views by clicking . In the side pane, you can set a view as the default by clicking .

title: Pay out fund dividends
body: Refresh the list by clicking  in the top right.

title: Pay out fund dividends
body: Export the list of dividends as an XLSX or CSV file.

title: Pay out fund dividends
body: For the whole list, click Export → Download as CSV/XLSX.

title: Pay out fund dividends
body: For parts of the list, select rows and click Export → Download as CSV/XLSX.

title: Pay out fund dividends
body: To enable dividend payments for a fund share class, open the Share class wizard, Basic info tab and select the Enable dividend payments option (see Add share classes).

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: To calculate dividends and create dividend transactions in the shareholder portfolios, follow the steps:

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Open the Dividends view.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Click Add dividend in the top-right corner of the view and fill in the fields:

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Fund

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The fund that pays the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Share class

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The share class that pays the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Declaration date

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The date when the dividend payment is announced.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Ex-date

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The dividend ex-date. The dividend is calculated based on the number of share class units in the shareholder's portfolio on the morning of the ex-date (the position after the previous day's transactions). This date will become the transaction date of the created dividend transaction. When you calculate NAV on the ex-date, the dividend isn't anymore included in NAV.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Payment date

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The payment date of the dividend, when the dividend is actually paid to the shareholder. Payment date becomes the settlement date of the created dividend transaction.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Dividend per unit

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The dividend to pay per share class unit.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Transaction type

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Transaction type to use for the dividend transactions. By default, FA Fund Management uses the Fund dividend (FMDIV) transaction type.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Memo

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Memo note for the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: If the dividend execution date is today, proceed to executing the dividend by clicking Save and execute.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Alternatively, save the dividend and execute it later (click Execute in the Dividends view).

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Check the tax rates and FX rate in the Dividend view that opens. Click Execute to generate dividend transactions. The dividend status changes to "Executing", and then to "Executed" in the Dividends view. You can view the dividend transactions by double-clicking the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: As a result, FA Fund management does the following:

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Creates dividend transactions in the shareholder portfolios.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Creates a cashout transaction (FMDWD type) to take out the dividend amount from the fund portfolio. Next time you calculate NAV, the total dividend amount is excluded from the calculation.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: You can ensure that all shareholders received dividends by clicking Reconcile in the Dividends view. The system shows a confirmation message that reads "Dividend transactions are created for all shareholders".

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: You can edit an unexecuted dividend by doing the following:

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: For the dividend you want to modify, click the icon and select Edit.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Make your changes in the side pane that opens.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: If you want to proceed to executing the dividend, click Save and execute and fill in the tax rates and FX rate. If you want to execute the dividend later, click Save.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: You can cancel dividend transactions for executed dividends, for example, if you notice that some tax rates are incorrect or if the error is due to incorrect positions in shareholder portfolios. To cancel dividend transactions, do the following:

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Double-click an executed dividend in the list.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Select the dividend transactions to delete and click the  icon.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: If needed, make corrections in the shareholders' portfolios.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Click Reconcile next to the dividend in the Dividends view and confirm that you want to execute missing transactions (Execute).

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Enter the correct dividend parameters (you can only correct tax or exchange rates that are not used in any transactions) and click Execute.

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: For executed fund dividends, the following information is available in the Dividend transactions view when you double-click a dividend row:

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Portfolio

title: Dividend transaction properties

title: Dividend transaction properties

title: Dividend transaction properties

title: Dividend transaction properties

title: Dividend transaction properties

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Amount of dividend assigned to the shareholder in the fund currency.

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Tax country

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Shareholder's tax country.

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Tax (currency)

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Amount of tax on the dividend amount in the fund currency.

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Amount paid (currency)

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Amount of dividend paid in the fund currency.

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Amount in account currency

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Amount of dividend paid in the shareholder's account currency.

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Account currency

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Shareholder's account currency.

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: FX rate

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: The FX rate used.

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Run time

title: Dividend transaction properties
body: Run date and time of the fund dividend payment.

title: View fund orders
body: The Orders view shows information about trade orders for funds. You can create, edit, and execute fund orders in FA Back. Fund orders can be executed manually in FA Back or via automatic order execution for funds so that incoming trade orders with Executable status are executed when you accept NAV (see Create a fund).

title: View the list of orders
body: In the Orders view, you can view the fund orders as a list and filter them by any column (for example, share class and status). You can choose a predefined transaction date period (today, previous 7 days, current month, previous month, current quarter, previous quarter) or select specific dates. In the Orders view, you can also:

title: View the list of orders
body: Save a view you created by clicking .

title: View the list of orders
body: Restore the view by clicking .

title: View the list of orders
body: Manage saved views by clicking . In the side pane, you can set a view as the default by clicking .

title: View the list of orders
body: Refresh the list by clicking  in the top right.

title: View the list of orders
body: Export the list of orders as an XLSX or CSV file.

title: View the list of orders
body: For the whole list, click Export → Download as CSV/XLSX.

title: View the list of orders
body: For parts of the list, select rows and click Export → Download as CSV/XLSX.

title: View order details
body: To view details for a fund order, click on a row in the list. In the side pane that opens, you can see the following information:

title: View order details
body: Fund order details: Shows the same information as the fund order list columns and the fund order execution method and reference.

title: View order details
body: Documents: Shows documents uploaded for the order, the tags applied to them, and the date and time they were last modified. You can download the documents to your computer.

title: Order information
body: Account

title: Order information
body: The fund or share account to record deposits and withdrawals. The default account used in trade orders is specified in the fund and share class settings

title: Order information
body: Cashflow (client)

title: Order information

title: Order information

title: Order information
body: The status of the fund order. The status options are: Open, Accepted, Executable, Sent to execution, In execution, Partially executed in the market, Executed in the market, Settled in the market, Executed, Cancelled, Rejected, and Expired.

title: Order information
body: Tags

title: Order information
body: The tags applied to the fund order. Tags can be used to sort trade orders or adjust the trade order workflow.

body: Tax 1 and 2

body: The tax amount in the transaction. For subscriptions, taxes add the trade amount, and for redemptions, taxes reduce the trade amount.

title: Order information

title: Order information

title: Order information

title: Order information
body: Transaction date

title: Order information

title: Order information
body: Transaction type

title: Order information
